title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2606/91 of 29 August 1991 fixing, for unginned cotton, the actual production for the 1990/91 marketing year and the estimated production, the adjustment in the maximum guaranteed quantity and the reduction in the aid for the 1991/92 marketing year
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 2606/91   of 29 August 1991   fixing, for unginned cotton,  the actual production for the 1990/91 marketing year and the estimated production, the adjustment  in the maximum guaranteed quantity and the reduction in the aid for the 1991/92 marketing year
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1.  For the 1990/91 marketing year,  actual production of unginned cotton is hereby determined at 991  743 tonnes.
2.  For the 1991/92 marketing year:
-  the estimated production is hereby fixed at 888  912 tonnes,
-  the maximum guaranteed quantity fixed by Regulation (EEC) No 1731/91 is hereby increased by 43   536 tonnes,
-  the reduction in the amount of the aid is hereby fixed at ECU 6,710 per 100 kilograms.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 September 1991.
This Regulation  shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments: Done at Brussels, 29 August 1991. For the Commission   Ray MAC SHARRY   Member of the Commission
